title: 113_s1011
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Boys Town Centennial Commemorative Coin Act". Boys Town is a nonprofit organization founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska. It serves children of all races and religions and gained worldwide recognition after a successful movie in 1938. Father Flanagan traveled globally to help war orphans, and Boys Town has since grown significantly. Boys Town, founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska, has expanded to 11 regions across the country, including California, Nevada, Texas, and more. The organization's National Hotline counsels over 150,000 callers annually, while the National Research Hospital specializes in hearing care and Usher Syndrome research. Boys Town's programs impact over 2 million children and families each year, with the 100th anniversary approaching on December 12th, 2017. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue commemorative $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half dollar clad coins in honor of the centennial of Father Flanagan's Boys Town. The $5 coins will weigh 8.359 grams, have a diameter of 0.850 inches, and contain 90% gold and 10% alloy. The $1 coins will weigh 26.73 grams, have a diameter of 1.500 inches, and contain 90% silver and 10% copper. The half dollar clad coins will have a limited mintage of 300,000. The commemorative coins for the centennial of Father Flanagan's Boys Town will weigh 11.34 grams, have a diameter of 1.205 inches, and be minted to the specifications for half dollar coins. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The design of the coins minted for the centennial of Boys Town will be emblematic of the organization's 100 years. The coins will feature a value designation, the year 2017, and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with Boys Town and reviewed by the Citizens of Coinage Advisory Committee. Coins minted under this Act for the centennial of Boys Town will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility. The Secretary is authorized to issue these coins between January 1, 2017, and December 31, 2018. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS.

Coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value of the coins plus the cost of designing and issuing them. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted at a reasonable discount.

SEC. 7. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary will ensure that minting and issuing coins under this Act will not cost the Federal Government.
